text: Over a year, what sort of drawdowns do people accept, per £1k of profit? I've ended up with a reasonable pnl overall, just under last year's profit. But was hoping to 10x it. I'm wondering if my fear of drawdowns is holding me back.

text: This feels like the wrong way to think about it. Kelly tells you what your stake should be relative to your bank factoring in edge and odds. Overbet, you die. Underbet, you plod, but don’t die.

elements.text: This feels like the wrong way to think about it. Kelly tells you what your stake should be relative to your bank factoring in edge and odds. Overbet, you die. Underbet, you plod, but
don’t
die.

text: A big reason to not accept large drawdowns, is that it makes it hard to differentiate variance from a strategy that for one reason or another is no longer working (bugs, changing market conditions, etc). These days my max drawdown is ~6% of annual profits

elements.text: A big reason to not accept large drawdowns, is that it makes it hard to differentiate variance from a strategy that for one reason or another is no longer working (bugs, changing market conditions, etc). These days my max drawdown is ~6% of annual profits

text:
Obviously market/event specific but in betting markets your concern should be optimising stake for liquidity / market impact. 

To answer your question any sort of drawdown that is outside of ‘normal’ should immediately make you question the impact you are having on the market. I am not sure what you are doing but it is very rare that you can simply 10x your bankroll (if that is what you are implying / concerned about) 

With my strategies it’s a case of thinking outside the box in order to increase turnover / profit, ie. can you scale horizontally

elements.text:
Obviously market/event specific but in betting markets your concern should be optimising stake for liquidity / market impact. 

To answer your question any sort of drawdown that is outside of ‘normal’ should immediately make you question the impact you are having on the market. I am not sure what you are doing but it is very rare that you can simply 10x your bankroll (if that is what you are implying / concerned about) 

With my strategies it’s a case of thinking outside the box in order to increase turnover / profit, ie. can you scale horizontally
